cards.title: Grandfather
setup: Put [i]Arrow of Time[/i] into play. Reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until a Design and Fulcrum are revealed. Put the first revealed Design and Fulcrum into play. Shuffle the rest into the villain deck.
gameplay: When there is only 1 villain Design in play, it is indestructible.
When there are 24 or more tokens on [i]Arrow of Time[/i], {Grandfather} controls the timeline. [b]The heroes lose.[/b]

At the end of each turn, if there are {H + 1} or more environment cards in the trash, each player may discard any number of cards. If {H} or more cards are discarded this way, flip {Grandfather}'s character cards.
cards.advanced: At the end of the villain turn, discard the top 2 cards of each hero deck.
flippedGameplay: When there is only 1 villain Design in play, it is indestructible.
When there are 24 or more tokens on [i]Arrow of Time[/i], {Grandfather} controls the timeline. [b]The heroes lose.[/b]
At the start of each player's turn, that player may discard any number of cards. For each card discarded this way, increase damage dealt to {Grandfather} by 1 this turn.
At the end of the villain turn, {Grandfather} deals each hero 3 energy damage.
cards.flippedAdvanced: Increase damage dealt to hero targets by 1.
cards.challengeText: At the start of the game, put [i]Strange Pocketwatch[/i] into play.

openingLines.default: Oh, don't worry, this will only hurt for a second!
openingLines.OmnitronUCharacter: Hm! You're essentially a sentient time-machine. Fascinating!
openingLines.OmnitronXCharacter: Hm! You're essentially a sentient time-machine. Fascinating!
openingLines.LaComodoraCharacter: Oh, hm, hello there! Any chance we could work togteher? Otherwise this timeline is going to get confusing!
openingLines.LaComodoraCurseOfTheBlackSpotCharacter: Oh, hm, hello there! Any chance we could work togteher? Otherwise this timeline is going to get confusing!
openingLines.Cauldron.DriftCharacter: Not to be rude, but I really don't have time for this...
openingLines.DriftingShadowDriftCharacter: Not to be rude, but I really don't have time for this...
openingLines.DualDriftCharacter: Er, are you supposed to be here now?
openingLines.TestSubjectHalberdDriftCharacter: Not to be rude, but I really don't have time for this...
openingLines.ThroughTheBreachDriftCharacter: Not to be rude, but I really don't have time for this...
openingLines.VainFacadePlaytest.FridayCharacter: My dear, is there no chance you'll sit this one out and let us continue this debate another time?
openingLines.VainFacadePlaytest.SphereCharacter: Did you? Oh, shoot, sorry! I got ahead of myself. You were saying?

cards.title: 4FZG Ray Gun
body: When this card enters play, if {Grandfather} is Covert, play the top 2 cards of the villain deck and destroy this card.
At the end of the villain turn, {Grandfather} deals the hero target with the highest HP {H + 1} irreducible energy damage.

flavorQuotes.text: Well, heavens, this just{BR}won't do at all! Fortunately, I{BR}came prepared.

cards.title: Accelerated Timetable
body: When this card enters play, play the top card of the villain deck.
At the start of the villain turn, play the top 2 cards of the villain deck and destroy this card.

flavorQuotes.text: If you don't mind me saying, Baroness{BR}Bogozi, what you really need is more time...

cards.title: Arrow of Time
body: This card is indestructible.

The first time each turn each villain card discards a card from each hero's deck, that hero may destroy 1 of their Ongoing or Equipment cards. If no card is destroyed this way, add a token to this card.
When a hero deck becomes empty, add a token to this card and put the bottom 5 cards of that deck's trash on top of the deck.

flavorQuotes.text: The amount of tachyons that man{BR}emits could power Bastion City!

cards.title: Bending the Rules
body: When this card is dealt damage, {Grandfather} deals himself X energy damage that cannot be redirected, where X = the damage this card takes this way.

At the end of the villain turn, discard the top card of the villain deck. If a target is discarded this way, play the top card of the villain deck. Otherwise, discard the top 5 cards of each hero deck.

flavorQuotes.text: Oh, shoot! Not again...

cards.title: Causal Cascade
body: Shuffle the villain trash into the villain deck.
Reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until a Fulcrum is revealed. Put it into play.
Shuffle the other revealed cards and this card into the villain deck.

flavorQuotes.text: The timeline resists{BR}alterations. It's only malleable at{BR}weak points. The more weak points,{BR}the easier the change.

cards.title: Confluence of Events
body: Play the top card of the environment deck.
Reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until a target is revealed. Put it into play. Discard the rest.

flavorQuotes.text: Friday's in town. Start{BR}looking out for Grandfather.{BR}Things are about to go wrong.

cards.title: Counting Down
body: At the end of the villain turn, if there are fewer than 2 non-Covert non-hero targets in play, play the top card of the environment deck.
At the end of the villain turn, the non-hero target with the second highest HP deals the 2 hero targets with the highest HP {H} melee damage each.

flavorQuotes.text: I'm sorry about your friends, but{BR}I'm glad you're here with me. The timeline is almost set. Be a doll and sit this one out?{BR}For your old man?

cards.title: Disaster Scenario
body: This card is indestructible while there are cards in the environment deck. When the environment deck is empty, destroy this card. Increase damage dealt by environment cards by 2.
At the end of the villain turn, discard the top card of the environment deck. If a target is discarded this way, play it. Otherwise, discard the top 5 cards of each hero deck.

flavorQuotes.text: {sigh} I guess{BR}my vacation's over.
Oh, I should think so!{BR}Everything goes downhill {BR}in about 5 minutes.

cards.title: Fallback Strategy
body: Reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until a Design is revealed. Put it into play. Discard the rest.

flavorQuotes.text: Golly Ned! That did not{BR}go according to plan. Plan B it{BR}is, then.

cards.title: Hunter
body: When this card enters play, increase damage dealt by this card by 2 this turn.
At the end of the villain turn, this card deals the hero target with the lowest HP {H - 2} melee damage.

flavorQuotes.text: You always said you{BR}wanted a closer look at{BR}a Dracimp infiltrator!
This is [b]NOT[/b] what I had in mind!

cards.title: Leader
body: Reduce damage dealt by hero targets by 1.
At the end of the villain turn, this card deals the hero target with the highest HP {H - 2} projectile damage.

flavorQuotes.text: Now, I don't want no more{BR}trouble from you folks. Come on out,{BR}now, or we're gonna have a problem.

cards.flavorReference: Sheriff Smithy, Grim Tidings: Killing Fields

cards.title: Minion
body: When this card enters play, if there are no other non-Covert villain targets in play, play the top card of the environment deck and the villain deck, then destroy this card.
At the end of the villain turn, this card deals the hero target with the highest HP {H - 1} projectile damage.

flavorQuotes.text: He'll manipulate{BR}events to get reinforcements if{BR}he can, but he'll pull them through{BR}time if he must.

cards.title: Obstacle to Progress
body: This card is indestructible while a target is next to it. Play this card next to the hero with the highest HP.

The first time each turn each villain card would deal damage, redirect that damage to the target next to this card. Any player may discard 1 card to redirect that damage to one of their targets instead.

flavorQuotes.text: I really despise violence, but I see{BR}no way for Bastion City to survive Sphere,{BR}without even getting into what comes next.

cards.title: Over the Line
body: Damage dealt by {Grandfather} is irreducible.
When this card enters play, discard the top 5 cards from each hero deck, then play the top card of the villain deck.
At the start of the villain turn, destroy this card.

flavorQuotes.text: Now that is quite enough! Get{BR}away from my daughter!

cards.title: Picking Up the Pieces
body: Shuffle the villain trash and reveal cards from it until a target is revealed. Put it into play.
If no targets entered play this way, play the top card of the villain deck.

flavorQuotes.text: Why... have you...{BR}repaired... me? I... failed.
Me too, little one. Me too. You'll be fine. I'll look after you.

cards.title: Quiet Meddling
body: When {Grandfather} would deal a hero target energy damage, that target's player may discard up to X cards from the top of their deck where X = the amount of damage. Reduce that damage by 1 for each card discarded this way.
At the end of the villain turn, {Grandfather} deals each hero 2 energy damage.

flavorQuotes.text: He's meddling{BR}from the sidelines... he...{BR}has a soft heart... He doesn't{BR}want to hurt anyone.

cards.title: Strange Pocketwatch
body: The first time each turn a card enters play from the top of the environment deck, play the top card of the villain deck.

flavorQuotes.text: I know we said we wouldn't kill{BR}him, but this... We can use this and the watch{BR}to destroy him! It's the right thing to-

cards.flavorReference: Last words of Geyser, Back to the Beginning

cards.title: Villain Showdown
body: When this card enters play, choose an active hero. This card counts as that hero's nemesis until it leaves play. This card is indestructible while it has 1 or more HP.
At the end of the villain turn, this card deals the hero target with the highest HP {H + 1} melee damage.

flavorQuotes.text: Dracimp infiltrator: Reaper series{BR}prototype combat mimic. Dangerously{BR}unstable. Power up at your own risk.
